cmg.cnsim.bitcoin

Class Blockchain

  • java.lang.Object
    • cmg.cnsim.bitcoin.Blockchain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStructure

    public class Blockchain
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStructure
    The Bitcoin's blockchain structure
    Author:
    Sotirios Liaskos for the Conceptual Modeling Group @ York University

    • Field Detail

      • blockchain

        java.util.ArrayList<Block> blockchain
        A list of blocks. Each Block's getParent() points to a parent Block

      • orphans

        java.util.ArrayList<Block> orphans
        List of orphan Blocks. Blocks end up here if they refer to a parent that does not exist in the blockchain (e.g., has delayed arrival). At key events the orphan Blocks are revisited.

      • tips

        java.util.ArrayList<Block> tips
        A list of tips.

        public Blockchain()

    • Method Detail

      • addToOrphans

        private void addToOrphans(Block b)
        Adds a block to the orphans list.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to be added.

      • addToStructure

        public void addToStructure(Block b)
        Crudely request the addition of a validated block to the blockchain. If the Block has a parent (e.g., it has arrived from another node) the parent must be found (by ID) and the Block must be appended on that parent. If parent is not found it is placed in orphans. If the Block does not have parent (e.g., block was just validated by the Node itself) it must be appended on the tallest non-overlapping path to genesis. In reality, the node will in every hash be aware of the parent of the node its it trying to validate and update it based on new events.
        Parameters:
        b - A validated block to be added to the chain.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Block block)
        Checks if a Block is contained in the blockchain. Search by ID.
        Parameters:
        block - Is the Block to be checked.
        Returns:
        Return true if it is contained false otherwise.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Transaction t)
        Checks if a Transaction is contained (anywhere) in the blockchain. Likely to be used in the gossip stage.
        Parameters:
        t - The Transaction to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if it is contained, false if it is not.

      • findParentOf

        private ITxContainer findParentOf(Block b)
        Finds the parent of a Block b.
        Parameters:
        b - The Block whose parent is to be found.
        Returns:
        A pointer to an object implementing ITxContainer (e.g., a Block)

      • getNonOverlappingTip

        public Block getNonOverlappingTip(Block b)
        Given a Block b find the tallest tip whose chain to the genesis does not contain transactions whose ID matches one of the IDs in the transactions in b. Searches form tallest to shortest. Return null if such tip is not found.
        Parameters:
        b - The block in question.
        Returns:
        The tallest tip whose chain to genesis does not overlap with b. Returns null if such tip were not found.

      • hasChainOverlap

        public boolean hasChainOverlap(Block b,
                               Block tip)
        Checks if any of the transactions in Block b exist in any of the transactions that are contained in blocks starting from tip and to the genesis block.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to check the overlap for.
        tip - The tip of the chain to check the overlap against.
        Returns:
        true if overlap exists false otherwise

      • placeBlockInChain

        private void placeBlockInChain(Block b)
        The Block has parent, i.e. is the result of propagation. If the parent does not exist in the blockchain, add the Block to the orphans. If it is found, first check for overlaps with the chain (checking transaction IDs). If those are not found, then just add the Block to the blockchain with that parent. Replace the parent in the tips list and update the height of the Block. If overlaps are found, then the Block is corrupt and must be discarded.
        Parameters:
        b - The Block to be added to the blockchain.

      • printOrphans

        public java.lang.String[] printOrphans()
        Prints the orphans list.
        Returns:
        An array of comma separated entries, one orphan per entry, in the format: BlockID, ParentID, Transactions (list of contained transaction IDs).

      • printOrphansReport

        public java.lang.String[] printOrphansReport(int nodeID)
        Like printOrphans() with additional information.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The node ID to be reported.
        Returns:
        An array of comma separated entries, one orphan per entry, in the format: SimTime, SysTime, (both at the time of the report) NodeID, BlockID, ParentID, Height, Content (list of transactions), Place (blockchain).

      • printStructure

        public java.lang.String[] printStructure()
        Print structure for direct presentation. Returns comma separated entries of the format: BlockID,ParentID,BlockHeight,Transactions
        Specified by:
        printStructure in interface IStructure
        Returns:
        An array of string presenting the structure.

      • printStructureReport

        public java.lang.String[] printStructureReport(int nodeID)
        Like printStructure() but with additional information including the ID of the node it exists.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - Node ID to be included in the report.
        Returns:
        An array of comma separated entries with format: SimTime, SysTime, (both at the time of the report) NodeID, BlockID, ParentID, Height, Content (list of transactions), Place (blockchain).

      • printTips

        public java.lang.String printTips(java.lang.String sep)
        Prints the IDs of the Blocks currently in the list of tips
        Parameters:
        sep - The character to separate the entries with (e.g. "," for comma)
        Returns:
        A string listing the IDs of the tips.

      • processOrphans

        private void processOrphans()
        Recursive function: for each orphan in the orphans list try to place in the chain using placeBlockInChain. Repeat this loop (through a recursive call) until no orphan in the list can be placed in the chain.

      • pushBlockToChain

        private void pushBlockToChain(Block b)
        Pushes a newly validated block without parents (e.g., just validated by the node) to blockchain. It gets the tallest non-overlapping tip and appends the block there while replacing the block's parent with the block in the tips list. While a block always contains a parent while being validated, we assume here that the parent is selected after validation. This normally does not cause any violence to the consensus proceedings, given that such parents is guaranteed to exist (mining pool is always valid and non-overlapping). In case it does, an error is printed in the Log file. If the chain is empty, make the block a genesis block with null as a parent.
        Parameters:
        b - The block to be pushed to the blockchain
